bibl.title: Evidence for a Reduction in Laographia at Philadelphia in Gaius' Second Year.
Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology
bibl.author: Hanson, Ann Ellis

bibl.note: The celebrations attending both Gaius' accession and his recovery from illness were remembered with a joy which spread over the empire. It seems possible that Gaius responded by reducing the tribute owed to Rome, as signalled in the registers from Philadelphia.
Hanson Ann Ellis, Evidence for a Reduction in Laographia at Philadelphia in Gaius' Second Year.
Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology (Chico, 1981) pp. 345-355.
